channel.title: SocketException
channel.description:
Hey all.
I connect to minecraft.moparisthebest.com and after about 30 seconds I get a java.net.SocketException error. Is this anything to do with /register? Because I did /register ******** and nothing happened.

item.title: SocketException
item.dc:creator: @Fuse Fuse
item.description:
@Fuse wrote:

CoonHunter:

Big comes in two different forms when it comes to Minecraft. The map size (the actual large peices of data), and just communication (rather tiny), with dial-up, the entire process is dummied down to (on adverage) downloading a 2-3MB peice around yourself (turn down your render distance aka fog and it might help this) and all of communication at the same time. I would suggest sticking to SSP rather than SMP until you have access to faster internet, as until Notch optimises everything, it won’t work well at all.

Haha, this is with tiny rendering, smooth lighting off and what-not else. Thanks, mate.

Read full topic

item.title: SocketException
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Big comes in two different forms when it comes to Minecraft. The map size (the actual large peices of data), and just communication (rather tiny), with dial-up, the entire process is dummied down to (on adverage) downloading a 2-3MB peice around yourself (turn down your render distance aka fog and it might help this) and all of communication at the same time. I would suggest sticking to SSP rather than SMP until you have access to faster internet, as until Notch optimises everything, it won’t work well at all.

Read full topic

item.title: SocketException
item.dc:creator: @Fuse Fuse
item.description:
@Fuse wrote:

Dial-up indeed.

My FPS is pretty good considering most games, but I guess it’s down to my connection. I can play RuneScape alright though - is Minecraft a big game then?

Read full topic

item.title: SocketException
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Fuse:

Windows XP Professional SP3. I keep timing out, even though I’m moving. Do you think it could be a hardware problem on my side? Might have a play around with the graphics card settings - thanks for your interest, Coon.

Generally if you ‘time out’ it is from a very slow connection speed. Are you on dial-up? I am on a VERY slow DSL (best i can get in the area though), but I can still play without any real lag, just chunk loading can be watched.

Read full topic

item.title: SocketException
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

If you have vista or win7, open up Start, and search (for winxp just start > run) %appdata%. You should see a .minecraft file there.

Read full topic

item.title: SocketException
item.dc:creator: @Fuse Fuse
item.description:
@Fuse wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:4, topic:386902”][quote author=Fuse link=topic=482672.msg3534844#msg3534844 date=1300492918]
It’s your client.
[/quote]
Hmm, my ‘client’ is actually just a Launcher, won’t have anything to do with minecraft itself, just I removed the validation for updates, and validation for logging in. Try going to the ‘.minecraft’ folder and renaming your ‘bin’ directory to something (so you know what it is) and let the launcher re-download the Update. If it still doesn’t work, I’ll try to login.[/quote]
Would I be able to even login to minecraft.moparisthebest.com without the .minecraft folder? Because I seem to not have it. I have searched the entire C:/ drive.

I downloaded your launcher quite a while back now but had to update my graphics card driver before being able to play; so I remember it loading up the files, just not where.

Read full topic

item.title: SocketException
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Fuse:

It’s your client.

Hmm, my ‘client’ is actually just a Launcher, won’t have anything to do with minecraft itself, just I removed the validation for updates, and validation for logging in. Try going to the ‘.minecraft’ folder and renaming your ‘bin’ directory to something (so you know what it is) and let the launcher re-download the Update. If it still doesn’t work, I’ll try to login.

Read full topic
